title: José Hernández (boxer)
text:
José Andrés Hernández (born 3 March 1976) is a Mexican former professional <a href="boxing">boxer</a> who competed from 1997 to 2009.
Life.
A native of <a href="Ciudad%20Ju%C3%A1rez">Ciudad Juárez</a>, Mexico, Hernandez now resides in <a href="Round%20Lake%2C%20Illinois">Round Lake, Illinois</a>.
Amateur career.
Jose Hernandez was the winner of the 1997 National Golden Gloves tournament in the 125 lbs division.
Professional career.
As of May 2007, Hernandez had a career record of 22-4 (14 KO), including an impressive knockout of highly touted prospect <a href="Jason%20Litzau">Jason Litzau</a> on December 16, 2006. On May 5, 2007 Hernandez was decisioned by <a href="Rocky%20Juarez">Rocky Juarez</a> on the undercard of the <a href="Oscar%20De%20La%20Hoya">Oscar De La Hoya</a> vs. <a href="Floyd%20Mayweather%2C%20Jr.">Floyd Mayweather, Jr.</a> fight.
